title.narrative: Lifesaving health services and famine response to IDPs and host communities in Northern Ethiopia

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide Essential life-saving health services and famine response to IDPs and host communities in Northern Ethiopia. This WHO project will provide (i) immediate implementation of Cholera preparedness interventions, completing the Oral Cholera Vaccination round 2 (OCV) campaign, resumption of COVID-19 response, strengthen the malaria prevention and response interventions; (ii) scale-up response to detect and care for people with mental health and psychosocial needs as a consequence of the conflict; (iii)strengthen the Tigray Regional Health Bureau (TRHB) and woreda health systems and the capacity to respond to malnutrition prevention and management especially for SAM with complications, in close coordination with the nutrition cluster;(iv) strengthen ongoing heightened surveillance for epidemics as well as streamline the supply chain management for health facilities and mobile health and nutrition services logistic platform to 2,471,000 people, including 570,770 women, 566,303 men, 1,333,927 children, and 619,192 persons with disabilities.
